summary: I Don’t Want Anymore [Bran Stark x Reader]
title: I Don’t Want Anymore [Bran Stark x Reader]
body:
Request: “heyy💛 can I request a bran x reader one shot in which the reader is in Love with him and he loves her too but is convinced they can‘t be together so the reader tries convincing him they can. Idk just some Bran fluff/Angst his Tag is so empty :( thank you!!!” by anonymous

A/n: This is my first time writing Bran so plz bare with me. Also, exams are killing me, this is the thrid time I’m having a headache in less than a week so there are probably going to be some tiny mistakes. really hope you like it though and don’t hesitate to leave a comment ❤

Words: 1000ish  ||   GoT Masterlist

I don’t want anymore.

That’s what Bran had told Tyrion when the Lannister had suggested he took lordship over Winterfell, but there is an exception for every rule. In Bran’s case that exception was you. Ever since he met you and your siblings all those years ago, the Stark had grown more than fond of your company. You had been there for him through everything and had even saved his life when Walkers threatened to kill all of you and somewhere along the way Bran had ended up falling in love with you.

However, after becoming the three eyed raved he knew life as a human was over and that meant the chance of being with you had fled. And even though he was supposed to be completely detached from desire, his thoughts wondered back to you more often than he would ever admit. No matter how much he tried to ignore those feelings, they only came back stronger every time he saw you. Even then, planning the strategy for the upcoming war with a stern expression in your face and pure determination glancing in your eyes, Bran believed you were the most beautiful person he had ever seen.

“You need to stay in the crypts, where you will be safe” Jon’s voice interrupted his thoughts

“We need to lure him into the open before his army destroys us all” he explained calmly, knowing very well the immensity of the risk he was putting himself into, as well as it being the only chance they had against the Night King.

“You can’t be seriously suggesting for us to use you as bait” you exclaimed loudly, shock and worry cursing through your veins. It was bad enough that most of you were probably going to die in the war, you couldn’t handle Bran being one of them. He was the memory of the world, which made his survival essential. Wanting to be honest, however, you’d admit there was another reason you couldn’t bear the thought of Bran being out there, a much more personal one.

For a while now, the Stark boy had been plaguing your thoughts day and night and you deny the fact that your heart almost skipped a beat every time he was nearby. Attempting and failing to ignore what that meant, you had finally accepted the truth. Your feelings towards Bran had changed from those of friendship and likeness to the one of love.

“It needs to be done” Bran replied, keeping his calm like he always did those days. Looking around, your eyes pleaded for anyone to come up with a better idea, anything that could prevent that crazy plan, but nothing came.

“Very well” you said putting an incredible amount of effort into holding back your emotions before making your way out of the room. As the door closed behind you, you leaned back against the wall and let out a deep sight, trying not to let the tears fall. You didn’t know how much time passed until the door opened again to reveal Bran.

“You are afraid” he noted, voice lacking any form of emotion

“How can I not be? This is suicide, Bran” you exclaimed turning to look at him

“I will not die, I have been shown the future” he said seeming unphased by your outburst

“The rest of us have not. I cannot stand by and watch you practically surrender to the enemy just because a vision showed you everything” you insisted somewhat sarcastically causing the ghost of a smile to appear on his face, the only sign of emotion you had detected on him in a long time.

“He didn’t show me everything. There are still things I don’t understand” he said

“Like what?” you shot back

“You have believed in my visions and repeatedly risked your life so that I could become what I am, why doubt me now?” for the first time you could see a hint of genuine curiosity in his eyes, mixed with something else you couldn’t quite place.

“Because I love you, gods damn it” you raised your voice, finally allowing your thoughts to be openly expressed. It was something you had been keeping in for far too long and letting go felt liberating.

“So did he” Bran replied bringing you back to reality with his cold tone “Bran Stark, I mean. He loved you with all his heart, but he is not here anymore” His voice remained calm as ever, but you noticed the look on his eyes had shifted into one of hope and affection.

“Yes, he is. Bran, this is you” you exclaimed, kneeling down so that the two of you were on the same level and taking his hand in yours.

“Y/n, this cannot happen” he sighted feeling his own heart break just as the words left his lips “I am the three eyed raven”

“So what?” you asked, too preoccupied by the fact that he had admitted to return your feelings to let anything ruin that.

“I am not supposed to want anymore. I can’t give you a home or a title” he explained and a traced of sadness could be clearly traced in his voice. That had been what he wanted all along and now that it was finally possible he had to deny. He may love you, but he could not condemn you to his way of life.

“I don’t want any of this, I want you” you insisted “I know you claim to live in the past, but it’s time you looked around and saw the present”

He knew he shouldn’t, but the way your hand seemed to fit perfectly into his combined with the almost pleading look in your eyes were all it took to change his mind. Cupping your face in his hand, he pulled you closed until your faces were inches apart. Looking for any sign of doubt, he found none so he placed his lips on your in a soft slow kiss. It was short lived and hesitant, but it was all you needed to feel your heart swell with warmth.

And maybe you were getting into something more complicated than you could fathom, but whatever it was, you were willing to go through it if it meant having Bran by your side.

Request: “heyy💛 can I request a bran x reader one shot in which the reader is in Love with him and he loves her too but is convinced they can‘t be together so the reader tries convincing him they can. Idk just some Bran fluff/Angst his Tag is so empty :( thank you!!!” by anonymous

A/n: This is my first time writing Bran so plz bare with me. Also, exams are killing me, this is the thrid time I’m having a headache in less than a week so there are probably going to be some tiny mistakes. really hope you like it though and don’t hesitate to leave a comment ❤

You had been there for him through everything and had even saved his life when Walkers threatened to kill all of you and somewhere along the way Bran had ended up falling in love with you.

However, after becoming the three eyed raved he knew life as a human was over and that meant the chance of being with you had fled. And even though he was supposed to be completely detached from desire, his thoughts wondered back to you more often than he would ever admit. No matter how much he tried to ignore those feelings, they only came back stronger every time he saw you. It was bad enough that most of you were probably going to die in the war, you couldn’t handle Bran being one of them. He was the memory of the world, which made his survival essential. Wanting to be honest, however, you’d admit there was another reason you couldn’t bear the thought of Bran being out there, a much more personal one.

You didn’t know how much time passed until the door opened again to reveal Bran.

“Because I love you, gods damn it” you raised your voice, finally allowing your thoughts to be openly expressed. It was something you had been keeping in for far too long and letting go felt liberating.

“So did he” Bran replied bringing you back to reality with his cold tone “Bran Stark, I mean. He loved you with all his heart, but he is not here anymore” His voice remained calm as ever, but you noticed the look on his eyes had shifted into one of hope and affection.

“Yes, he is. Bran, this is you” you exclaimed, kneeling down so that the two of you were on the same level and taking his hand in yours.

“Y/n, this cannot happen” he sighted feeling his own heart break just as the words left his lips “I am the three eyed raven”

“So what?” you asked, too preoccupied by the fact that he had admitted to return your feelings to let anything ruin that.

“I am not supposed to want anymore. I can’t give you a home or a title” he explained and a traced of sadness could be clearly traced in his voice. That had been what he wanted all along and now that it was finally possible he had to deny. He may love you, but he could not condemn you to his way of life.

“I don’t want any of this, I want you” you insisted “I know you claim to live in the past, but it’s time you looked around and saw the present”

He knew he shouldn’t, but the way your hand seemed to fit perfectly into his combined with the almost pleading look in your eyes were all it took to change his mind. Cupping your face in his hand, he pulled you closed until your faces were inches apart. Looking for any sign of doubt, he found none so he placed his lips on your in a soft slow kiss. It was short lived and hesitant, but it was all you needed to feel your heart swell with warmth.

And maybe you were getting into something more complicated than you could fathom, but whatever it was, you were willing to go through it if it meant having Bran by your side.

blog.description:
independent + selective
with characters from
american horror story
game of thrones
the walking dead
the vampire diaries
history & more.
please read rules
before interacting

summary: q u i c k  q u e s t i o n :: this has been bothering me since the GoT finale a few weeks ago. okay, it’s not the only thing...
body:
q u i c k  q u e s t i o n :: this has been bothering me since the GoT finale a few weeks ago. okay, it’s not the only thing that’s bothered me, obviously. but for a brief moment imma put character assassinations, main characters losing importance, and basically every plot line coming to nothing aside. and i’m going to ask something real quick and i hope that someone can give me an explanation? 

okay, so they name bran as the leader of westeros ( a conclusion that had no working up to. we hardly even saw him this season and then suddenly hes king very lame but a story for another day) , but then after being made king, sansa is all ‘the north needs independence.’ which confused me? because yeah, the north swore to never bow the knee again. but like the exact context of that oath was ‘we know no king but the king in the north and his name is stark’ and now the legit king of everything is literally the last living son of ned stark and his trueborn heir. so, what exactly are the north being freed from? and the north out of all the seven kingdoms always had a strong male preference when it comes to leaders. so like, why wouldn’t they want to bend the knee to bran but want to make sansa queen? i mean, just generally speaking, my question is: why would bending the knee to ned stark’s only living son be considered oppression for the north? Like I’d imagine some celebration that there’s a not only a northerner but a stark on the iron throne. Or am I missing something here?

Like I’d imagine some celebration that there’s a not only a northerner but a stark on the iron throne. Or am I missing something here?

summary: If anyone has any in canon prompt ideas (post canon or canon fill in) for any gendrya or sansa centric fics please send them my...
body:
If anyone has any in canon prompt ideas (post canon or canon fill in) for any gendrya or sansa centric fics please send them my way! I’d never written for GoT before, but i’m really enjoying delving into these characters this way! I’d be willing to write for: 

  • The Starks in any capacity as a family unit (NOT J*nsa) 
  • Sansa/Podrick
  • Sansa/Theon
  • Sansa/Margaery
  • Sansa/Meera
  • Sansa/(random northern lord/lady)
  • Gendry/Arya
  • Jon/Ygritte
  • Bran/Meera
  • Bran/Jojen 
  • Robb/Talisa

Idk if anyone is interested but i really enjoy writing fics, and GoT fics in canon are really fun, to get to explore these characters in a new way, so if you have any feel free to send me an ask or a DM!

summary: So with Isaac coming forward and saying D&D told him “King Bran” was GRRMs intended ending for Bran, has anyone seen that Emilia...
body:
So with Isaac coming forward and saying D&D told him “King Bran” was GRRMs intended ending for Bran, has anyone seen that Emilia or Kit have said something similar of Jon and Dany’s fates?

Because, if not, I’m really questioning it. I know I go back and forth, but why would D&D be so open with Isaac saying, “yeah this is straight from George,” but not do the same, if it were true, with Kit and Emilia?

Especially with the impact Dany’s turn had on both actors, don’t you think D&D would want to reassure them that it wasn’t their doing but George’s??

blog.description: Main blog: nightqueendany.tumblr.com. This blog is strictly dedicated to asks. Any asks I get on the other blog, I will repost here.

summary: Bran's actor said King Bran is GRRM's idea
question: Bran's actor said King Bran is GRRM's idea
answer:
Many of us already figured that. Link?

Apparently there was an email that leaked a few weeks ago saying that they had wanted to originally kill Bran but GRRM said they couldn’t kill him - my guess was that that was because he ends up King. It makes sense, somewhat. His was the first POV chapter of the series. Though George will write it way fucking better than D&D.

I’m hoping in the books he’s still the Bran who’s my second favorite character of the series. I’d love King Bran - if he’s Bran and not robot Bran from the show.

summary: I understand the criticism of Bran Stark’s arch in the show being insufficiently carried out to lead to its conclusion. But if...
body: I understand the criticism of Bran Stark’s arch in the show being insufficiently carried out to lead to its conclusion. But if you’re a book reader, unwilling to let GRRM do a better job with King Bran than the show did, if you’re already calling it quits and angrily burning your books, you might want to question your ableism and your entitlement.

reblog.comment: I understand the criticism of Bran Stark’s arch in the show being insufficiently carried out to lead to its conclusion. But if you’re a book reader, unwilling to let GRRM do a better job with King Bran than the show did, if you’re already calling it quits and angrily burning your books, you might want to question your ableism and your entitlement.

But if you’re a book reader, unwilling to let GRRM do a better job with King Bran than the show did, if you’re already calling it quits and angrily burning your books, you might want to question your ableism and your entitlement.

summary: I feel like a lot of fans especially the BNFs miss the point about Aegon. I think GRRM is better than adding a huge plot...
question: I feel like a lot of fans especially the BNFs miss the point about Aegon. I think GRRM is better than adding a huge plot changing character midway through the series just to make the heroes look good, or for a short obstacle. He doesn’t even work as a fake protagonist like Robb or some finger wagging insert against lazy fantasy writers who write those types of heroes cause he was added too late to be effective that way. Aegon’s about Jon and Dany, how far Dany will go for her ambitions and
answer:
How far Jon and Dany can go (burning Kings Landing, killing a good king) before they become the villains. Basically everything they accuse Aegon of being, everything they question about him, is really about Jon and Dany. Why do they deserve the throne, anymore than Aegon? Why should they be supported anymore than him?

Exactly. Aegon isn’t there to be a hero which is why they hate him. He is there to motivate the protagonists and pose important questions to the readers. Aegon is a decent king, he has flaws, he’ll make mistakes but he is what Westeros needs. The question to the reader is should Daenerys and maybe Jon wage war against him because they and the readers believe they have a greater claim to the Iron Throne? Should a king beloved by the smallfolk be set aside for two people with great destinies? Initially the answer would be yes. Think of how many fics and mets have been written about why Aegon doesn’t deserve the throne but Jon and Daenerys do. That’s 80% of all content about the character. Despite being presented as a solution to several problems, people want to see Aegon fail, they believe he hasn’t ‘earned’ it or he simply doesn’t deserve it. So GRRM will write it, and based on what we got on the show, it will horrify the readers because they’ll be forced to read what entitlement and great destinies actually mean for the smallfolk. It will expose the fact that kingship is more than just claims to the throne or military might, it’s about serving the realm. 

This is why king Bran will work. In a way Bran will be similar to Aegon, only we would have spent more time seeing Bran sacrifice so much for the world. Bran won’t take the throne because he has king’s blood, it would be given to him because he represents all the tenets of the ideal king. GRRM will show us something promising with Aegon but Bran will be the one to fulfill it.

blog.name: morkhan
blog.title: There's a hole in the internet.

summary: I'm rewatching clips from Bran's storyline and they really just. did that. God, they really did just completely waste him,...
body:
I’m rewatching clips from Bran’s storyline and they really just. did that. God, they really did just completely waste him, didn’t they? they had multiple characters say, more than once, that all of the kings and weapons and armies of Westeros couldn’t stop the White Walkers and the Army of the Dead. that only Bran could do it.

and then season 8 rolls around and they really just have him… sit there. the whole fight.

the ability to see all of history as it truly happened, to uncover knowledge and secret truths that would otherwise be lost forever. warging abilities that are, in the show’s canon, completely unheard-of and unmatched in strength. intimate knowledge of how the Night King came to be, of the exact magic that created him, that no one else could possibly possess.

and the sum total of his contributions to the War for the Dawn is to say something nice to Theon, look around through some ravens, and then just chill while he waits for Arya to stab the Big Bad.

God, the sheer laziness. the layers of storytelling incompetence. the utter lack of creativity. the complete absence of care. every time I think I have a handle on how badly D&D mishandled this ending, I am struck anew by some new aspect of their buffoonery.

at this point, I wouldn’t trust these clowns to tell a bedtime story.

tags: grrm's free to prove me wrong
summary: Do you think Bran will be king in the books? GRRM apparently told D&D and Isaac that Bran would end up being king, but I...
question: Do you think Bran will be king in the books? GRRM apparently told D&D and Isaac that Bran would end up being king, but I personally think he will most likely end up as King in the North.
answer:
Yeah, to be honest, this is the thing that feels most like “early draft plan that doesn’t work five full books of prose later.” As many people have pointed out, it feels exceptionally random.

King in the North, sure. That works. King of Westeros? Not so much.

reblog.comment:
Yeah, to be honest, this is the thing that feels most like “early draft plan that doesn’t work five full books of prose later.” As many people have pointed out, it feels exceptionally random.

King in the North, sure. That works. King of Westeros? Not so much.

trail.content_raw:
Yeah, to be honest, this is the thing that feels most like “early draft plan that doesn’t work five full books of prose later.” As many people have pointed out, it feels exceptionally random.

King in the North, sure. That works. King of Westeros? Not so much.
trail.content:
Yeah, to be honest, this is the thing that feels most like “early draft plan that doesn’t work five full books of prose later.” As many people have pointed out, it feels exceptionally random.

King in the North, sure. That works. King of Westeros? Not so much.

summary: bran stark: was lord of winterfell (lord of the six kingdoms) journeyed beyond the wall to find the 3 eyed raven, staying in the...
body:
bran stark:

  • was lord of winterfell (lord of the six kingdoms)
  • journeyed beyond the wall to find the 3 eyed raven, staying in the cave and embracing his destiny (serves the realm)
  • became the three eyed raven (protector of the realm)
  • has no strong alliance to any ethnicity or house (king of the andals, first men and rhoynar)
